fchen

Class HashTreeBasedOutsourcing

  • java.lang.Object
    • fchen.HashTreeBasedOutsourcing

  • public class HashTreeBasedOutsourcing
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the protocol of verifiable encrypted file search on a cloud. The basic tool is the hash authentication tree.
    Author:
    Chen, Fei (https://sites.google.com/site/chenfeiorange/), First draft on 12-03-2013. License: GNU GPL, Email: chenfeiorange@163.com

    • Constructor Detail

      • HashTreeBasedOutsourcing

        public HashTreeBasedOutsourcing(java.lang.String rootDirectory)
        It constructs the main object.
        Parameters:
        rootDirectory - - the directory to be outsourced

      • HashTreeBasedOutsourcing

        public HashTreeBasedOutsourcing(java.lang.String rootDirectory,
                        double loadFactor)

    • Method Detail

      • KeyGen

        public void KeyGen()
        This function generates the secret key used in the protocol. We fix the secret key in the experiments; in practice, this is set by the data owner.

      • prepareOutsource

        public void prepareOutsource()
        The function does some preparation work for outsourceing. This is used for performance evaluation.

      • outsource

        public void outsource()
        This function helps a data owner outsource the data. The data owner only keeps the secret key and the root value of the hash tree.

      • query

        public byte[] query(java.lang.String file)
        This function helps a data user generate a query token when he wants to fetch a file from the cloud.
        Parameters:
        file - - the filename of the queried file
        Returns:
        - its MAC

      • search

        public ProofData search(byte[] queryFile)
        This function helps a cloud answer a query of a data user by searching all the files.
        Parameters:
        queryFile - - a query token send by the data user
        Returns:
        the query result represented by the data class 'ProofData'

      • verify

        public boolean verify(byte[] queryFile,
             ProofData proof)
        This function helps a data user to check whether the returned result from the cloud is correct.
        Parameters:
        queryFile - - the query token sent to the cloud by the data user
        proof - - the returned result from the cloud
        Returns:
        true if the cloud is honest; false if the cloud cheats

      • bytes2HexString

        public static java.lang.String bytes2HexString(byte[] b)
        It transforms a byte array into a string in the Hexadecimal format in an entry-wise way.
        Parameters:
        b - The byte array.
        Returns:
        The hexadecimal string.

      • getRandomExistingFile

        public java.lang.String getRandomExistingFile()
        This function generates a random existing filename. It is used for performance evaluation.
        Returns:
        - an existing filename

      • getRandomNonExistingFile

        public java.lang.String getRandomNonExistingFile()
        This function generates a random non-existing filename. It is used for performance evaluation.
        Returns:
        - a non-existing filename

        public double getLoadFactor()
